net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.common

Class Rectangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api.AbstractDatatype
      • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.common.Point
        • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.common.Rectangle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Datatype

    public class Rectangle
extends Point
    This is the Datatype for a 2-dimensional rectangle measured in pixels.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public Rectangle(int x,
                 int y,
                 int width,

        The constructor.
        Parameters:
        x - is the x-position.
        y - is the y-position.
        width - is the width.
        height - is the height.

    • Method Detail

      • moveTo

        public Rectangle moveTo(Point p)
        Creates a new Rectangle of this moved to the given Point.
        Parameters:
        p - is the Point to move to.
        Returns:
        a new Rectangle with the same size and located at the given Point.

      • moveTo

        public Rectangle moveTo(int newX,
                        int newY)
        Creates a new Rectangle of this moved to the point given by x and y.
        Parameters:
        newX - is the new x-position.
        newY - is the new y-position.
        Returns:
        a new Rectangle with the same size and located at the given point.

      • moveBy

        public Rectangle moveBy(Point p)
        Creates a new Rectangle of this moved from its current position relatively by the to the given Point.
        Parameters:
        p - is the Point with the delta-coordinate to move by.
        Returns:
        a new Rectangle with the same size and moved by the given Point.

      • moveBy

        public Rectangle moveBy(int dx,
                        int dy)
        Creates a new Rectangle of this moved from its current position relatively by the to the given dx and dy coordinate offsets.
        Parameters:
        dx - is the value to add to the x-position. May be negative to move left.
        dy - is the value to add to the y-position. May be negative to move up.
        Returns:
        a new Rectangle with the same size and moved by the given offset.

      • clipTo

        public Rectangle clipTo(Rectangle clippingArea,
                        boolean move)
        This method calculates a clipped variant from this Rectangle that fits inside the given clippingArea.
        Parameters:
        clippingArea - is the Rectangle the result has to fit in.
        move - - if true that try to avoid resizing the resulting Rectangle by moving towards the top left of the clippingArea, false otherwise (if resizing is appreciated).
        Returns:
        the clipped Rectangle fitting inside the clippingArea.

      • resize

        public Rectangle resize(int dx,
                        int dy,
                        Direction direction,
                        int minWidth,
                        int minHeight)
        Calculates a new Rectangle from this resized by dx and dy in the given Direction.
        Parameters:
        dx - is the delta offset for the x-position.
        dy - is the delta offset for the y-position.
        direction - is the Direction where to resize.
        minWidth - is the minimum width.
        minHeight - is the minimum height.
        Returns:
        the resized Rectangle.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns:
        the width of this Rectangle in pixel.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns:
        the height of this Rectangle in pixel.

      • getX2

        public int getX2()
        Returns:
        the x-position of the bottom right edge of this Rectangle.

      • getY2

        public int getY2()
        Returns:
        the y-position of the bottom right edge of this Rectangle.
